alert.note: Alert for Richland (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 1:20AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Richland and northern Franklin Parishes through 215 AM CDT... At 120 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Start, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rayville, Mangham, Start, Delhi, Bakers, Warden, Holly Ridge, Archibald, Buckner, Crowville, Alto and Baskin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for northeastern Louisiana.
